get_scheduler_info(scheduler, logger)[source]

get_scheduler_info(, scheduler, logger) Description:

This function is to log all the details about the apscheduler.backgroundScheduler

Args:

scheduler: (the object of the apscheduler that you wish to log information about

logger: the objecct of the logging module that is responsible for logging into the log file.

rollover()[source]
Function: rollover()

Descirption: This function is for rotationThreshold of history log files that readers generates; how it works is that if will rename the current history log files that all readers are writing to and create a new file with old name history log files.

Args: None

schedule_background_job()[source]
Description:

This function is to schedule the rollover job for rotating files. This function uses apscheduler library in python to schedule the job.

Args: None

src.utils.launcher module

class src.utils.launcher.Launcher(installed_browsers, logger, options)[source]

Bases: object

launch_reader(browser)[source]

Function launches the reader based on the browser provided

Args: browser: browser name

mode: mode in which the reader should run scheduled_window: time window in which the reader should run logdir: directory where the log file should be stored logmode: mode in which the log file should be stored

start()[source]
start function:

starts the reader based on the options provided It validates the browser option whether it’s all, single or multiple It launches the reader based on the browser option provided

Args: None

src.utils.metadata.get_browser_version(user_profile_dir, browser_name)[source]

Return the latest browser version by reading the version file of the specified browser. :param user_profile_dir: User profile directory :param browser_name: Name of the browser (e.g., “Edge”, “Firefox”, etc.) :return: Latest browser version

src.utils.metadata.has_root_privilege()[source]

Check if the script has root privilege in Linux. :return: True if running with root privilege, False otherwise.
